alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 215 PM MST... At 127 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Estrella, or 19 miles east of Gila Bend, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Estrella, Estrella Sailport, Sonoran National Monument, Big Horn and Mobile. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 128 and 141. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 13 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County
